DOC.brief_summary: This study aims to investigate whether follow-up with a psychologist has an impact on the outcome of patients with an implantable automated defibrillator.
DOC.brief_title: Psychological Intervention modifiEs Outcome of Patients With implAntable Cardioverter dEfibrillator: The PEACE Study
DOC.detailed_description: The implantation of an ICD in primary prevention is known to increase the rates of anxiety and depression, which can reach up to 45% and 35% respectively in this patient population. Several studies have reported that psychological accompaniment for these patients can alleviate the symptoms of anxiety and/or depression. Therefore, we aim to investigate the utility of psychological follow-up for a period of 1 year after first implantation of an ICD for primary prevention.
DOC.criteria: adult patients (aged 18 years or over) indication for implantation of an ICD for primary prophylaxis written informed consent provided patients with social security coverage patients under legal tutorship or guardianship patients with no social security coverage patients still within the exclusion period after participation in another clinical trial, as indicated by the national registry of clinical trial volunteers patients unable to complete the questionnaires (language barriers, mentally deficient, illiteracy or dementia) patients awaiting heart transplant patients who refuse to provide written informed consent
